question:
Which of the following are the recommendations of National Commission on Farmers (NCF)?
  1. Agriculture should be moved from state list to union list
  2. Agriculture Risk Fund should be established
  3. Gyan Chaupals should be established in the farmers’ distress areas
Select the correct option from codes given below:
explanation:
The government of India constituted the National Commission on Farmers (NCF) chaired by Professor M.S. Swaminathan on November 18, 2004. The commission submitted five reports to the government in between 2004 to 2006. The major recommendations given by the commission are:
  • Agriculture should be moved into the concurrent list
  • Million Wells Recharge programme should be started
  • Agriculture Risk Fund should be established
  • State level Farmers’ Commission should be established
  • Market Intervention Schemes (MIS)
  • Village Knowledge Centres (VKCs) or Gyan Chaupals in the farmers’ distress hotspots.
  • MSP should be at least 50% more than the weighted average cost of production.
  • The “net take-home income” of farmers should be comparable to those of civil servants.
  • Jal Swaraj with Gram Sabhas serving as Pani Panchayats
